data.prayer: Spirit, encourage the church of Carolina, Puerto Rico that they are blessed with every heavenly blessing.
data.verse: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in Christ

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Carolina, Puerto Rico
data.section_summary: What needs would people have here?

data.prayer: Spirit, inspire Bible translators to communicate the Scriptures accurately in the heart languages spoken in Carolina, Puerto Rico.
Jesus, please give your people in Carolina, Puerto Rico a passion for the lost.
data.verse: We are therefore Christ’s ambassadors, as though God were making his appeal through us. We implore you on Christ’s behalf: Be reconciled to God.

data.prayer: Father, encourage your church in Carolina that you never forsake them.
data.verse: Those who know your name will put their trust in you, for you, Yahweh, have not forsaken those who seek you.

data.prayer: Spirit, give the disciples of the the state of Carolina words, actions, signs and wonders to proclaim the coming of the Kingdom.
data.verse: As you go, proclaim this message: "The kingdom of heaven has come near."

data.prayer: Spirit, help the disciples in the state of Carolina to find a person of peace today, like the Philippian jailer, who heard and was immediately baptized with his whole family.
data.verse: And they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all who were in his house. And he took them the same hour of the night and washed their wounds; and he was baptized at once, he and all his family.

data.prayer: God, we ask you to raise up elders and deacons from the 47,794 believers in Carolina, who will serve the church and equip it to do your work.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up until we all reach unity in the faith and in the knowledge of the Son of God and become mature, attaining to the whole measure of the fullness of Christ.
